title.cn: 大家最容易忽视的内在健康，其实是骨骼健康！
title.en: The inner health most easily overlooked is actually bone health!

info.cn: 现在的人，身上总有那么一两种疾病缠身，无论大小。当这些症状表现出来时，人们才会去有所警觉，但是有些病症往往并不能显示出来。就容易让人们忽视，而骨骼健康就是其中一大类型。
info.en: Now people, there are always one or two kinds of diseases, regardless of size. People are alert when these symptoms show up, but some symptoms are often not manifest. Bone health is one of the major types of people who tend to ignore it.

content.cn:
现在的人，身上总有那么一两种疾病缠身，无论大小。当这些症状表现出来时，人们才会去有所警觉，但是有些病症往往并不能显示出来。就容易让人们忽视，而骨骼健康就是其中一大类型。

要知道关节困扰不是小事。当软骨老化磨损，暴露关节的神经和血管，硬骨互相摩擦就会引发疼痛和发炎。当软骨磨损持续加重，就会引发各种症状。你是不是早晨起来关节会变得僵硬？蹲起的时候关节感到疼痛？上下楼时关节更加疼痛难忍，有时关节还会'嘎嘎'作响？

软骨

软骨在人体中起到承重负荷，减少关节间骨骼摩擦等重要的作用，就像骨头与骨头间的'润滑剂'，减轻关节摩擦、承受负荷、吸收震荡。

在日常生活中，应尽量增加运动，以便促进关节的血液循环。但是，运动却不能过量，现在很多关节类疾病，都是由于软骨损伤所造成的。30岁后，软骨的延伸能力和恢复能力就开始减弱，再加上关节液减少使关节软骨变得干燥，关键软骨就容易发生损伤、磨损，而引发退行性关节炎。

而软骨受损，都是氨糖惹的祸。氨糖是形成软骨细胞的重要营养素之一，也是软骨基质和关节液的基本成分。人在20岁以后关节软骨不再生长，30岁以后氨糖含量不断降低且不再生成，关节软骨出现退化，营养流失加速且弹性减弱，再加上长期的磨损，极易引发关节疾病。尤其到55岁以后，骨关节炎发病率高达80%，严重影响中老年人的日常生活。

除以上因素以外，骨密度、骨质量和骨强度也是影响骨骼健康非常关键的因素。

骨密度

骨密度是反映单位面积(或体积)骨组织中骨矿物质等物质含量的一个医学术语。骨密度属于反映骨量减少或骨质疏松程度、预测骨折风险的一个间接指标。

骨密度在很大程度上受遗传因素影响，如非洲人的骨密度会高于亚洲人。同样，骨密度在儿童时期开始增加，约25岁达到峰值；然后保持10年左右；35岁以后每年以0.3%~0.5%的速率降低。

骨质量

骨质量是用以描述骨的材料学特征和结构强度的生物力学术语，反映的是骨矿含量以外可影响骨强度的其他一些因素。通俗一点讲，骨质量为骨骼对抗外力而不发生骨折的能力。而骨质量的减少，则会增加骨脆性从而造成骨质疏松等伤害。

骨强度

骨强度又被称为抗骨折能力。骨强度取决于骨密度和骨质量，其中骨质量是骨强度的物质和结构基础。骨强度包括骨几何结构、骨密度、骨骼的材料性能、体重及骨骼所受外力等因素。一般而言，骨密度越高，骨强度也就越高。

身体健康只有自己知道，所以无论身体的什么部位都需要我们自己去细心呵护，哪怕是深藏在身体内部的、我们看不到的地方。
content.en:
Now people, there are always one or two kinds of diseases, regardless of size. People are alert when these symptoms show up, but some symptoms are often not manifest. Bone health is one of the major types of people who tend to ignore it.

Know that joint trouble is no small matter. When cartilage ages and wears away, the nerve and blood vessels that expose the joints rub against each other and cause pain and inflammation. When cartilage wear continues to increase, it can cause all kinds of symptoms. Do you get up in the morning and your joints become stiff? Do you feel pain in your joints when you squat? The joints are more painful when you walk up and down, and sometimes the joints rattle

cartilage

Cartilage plays a load-bearing role in the body, reducing the joint skeleton friction and other important effects, such as bones and bones between the 'lubricant', reducing joint friction, bear the load, absorb shock.

In daily life, exercise should be increased as much as possible so as to promote circulation of the joints. However, exercise can not be excessive, and now many joint diseases are caused by cartilage damage. After 30 years of age, the cartilage's ability to stretch and recover begins to weaken, together with the loss of joint fluid that makes cartilage become dry. Cartilage is prone to damage, wear and tear and cause degenerative arthritis.

The damage to the cartilage, glucosamine is to blame. Glucosamine is an important nutrient to form cartilage cells was one of the basic components, also of the cartilage matrix and synovial fluid. In human articular cartilage after 20 years old no longer growth, glucosamine content decreased continuously after 30 years old and no longer generate articular cartilage degradation, loss of nutrients and accelerate the reduced flexibility, coupled with long-term wear, can easily lead to joint disease. Especially after the age of 55, the incidence of osteoarthritis is as high as 80%, which seriously affects the daily life of the middle-aged and elderly. In addition to these factors, bone mineral density, bone quality, and bone strength are the key factors that affect bone health in

.

bone density

Bone density is the unit area (or volume) of a medical term for bone tissue bone mineral substance content. Bone mineral density (BMD) is an indirect index reflecting bone loss or osteoporosis and predicting fracture risk.

Bone mineral density is largely influenced by genetic factors, such as bone density in Africans is higher than in asians. Similarly, bone density began to increase in childhood, peaked at about 25 years, then stayed about 10 years; after 35 years of age, the rate of 0.3%~0.5% decreased annually.

Bone quality

Bone mass is a biomechanical term used to describe the material characteristics and structural strength of bone, reflecting other factors that affect bone strength beyond bone mineral content. Generally speaking, bone quality is the ability of skeleton to resist external force without fracture. The decrease in bone mass increases bone fragility, resulting in osteoporosis and other injuries.

Bone strength

Bone strength is also known as fracture resistance. Bone strength depends on bone mineral density and bone mass, where bone mass is the basis for material and structural strength of bone. Bone strength includes factors such as bone geometry, bone density, material properties, weight, and external forces of the bones. Generally speaking, the higher the bone mineral density is, the higher the bone strength is.

Health is only known by ourselves, so whatever part of the body we need to take care of ourselves, even if it's deep inside the body, where we can't see it.
